output_list.reason: The mintToken function does not have a check to prevent overflow of the total supply. This can be exploited to mint tokens to any address, granting them arbitrary amounts of the token.
The _transfer function does not check if the target address is a smart contract, allowing a user to transfer tokens to a smart contract that has a fallback function, causing a loss of tokens.
The sell function has an integer overflow vulnerability, allowing a user to buy an arbitrary large amount of tokens, draining the contract of funds.
The mintToken function is only protected by the owner modifier, allowing any address to mint tokens to any other address, granting them arbitrary amounts of the token.

The transfer function does not have a check to prevent overflow of the recipient's balance. This can be exploited to transfer tokens to a smart contract that has a fallback function, causing a loss of tokens.
